intro: Senecio evenius, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green and hairy, while the flowers are small and white or pale blue. Senecio evenius is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
